intro: Anetanthus disjuncta, commonly known as the Disjunct Anetanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features include a slender stem, aromatic foliage, and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
